question.q:
<55a>Bordetella bronchiseptica, one of the causative agents of Canine Infectious Respiratory Disease (CIRD) or kennel
cough syndrome is most closely related
to which human bacterial pathogen:</55a>

<50>Bordetella bronchiseptica has been shown to
be a HUMAN pathogen. The following HUMAN patient populations can be susceptible to infection by Bordetella bronchiseptica, one of the causative agents for Canine Infectious Respiratory Disease (CIRD) also known as kennel cough:</50>

answers.a: <36a>Cancer patients, cystic fibrosis patients, transplant patients, and HIV patients</36a>

question.q:
<55a>BRONCHICINE CAe® is the only
non-adjuvanted, parenterally administered Bordetella bronchiseptica vaccine in the US.
The CAe stands for:</55a>

answers.a: <40a>To be friendly with wild-haired California kids</40a>
<40a>To stimulate both mucosal immunity (IgA) AND humoral immunity (IgG)</40a>
